Classical.Structure: The Peripheral Nervous System (PNS). Consists of all nerves and ganglia outside the Central Nervous System (D4.CNS). It is divided into the Somatic (voluntary) and Autonomic (involuntary, D4.ANS) systems.
Classical.Function: Connects the CNS to the limbs, organs, and skin. Transmits sensory information (somatic/interoceptive) to the CNS and motor commands from the CNS.
Classical.Pathology: Peripheral neuropathy, carpal tunnel syndrome, Guillain-Barr√© syndrome.

SCPN.L2_NeurochemicalNeurological: The organism-wide 'L2 data bus'. Carries all afferent L2 sensory data (e.g., from D3.Gut.ENS) and efferent L2 motor commands.
SCPN.L3_GenomicEpigeneticMorphogenetic: Contains Schwann cells, which create the morphogenetic field for nerve regeneration (myelin sheath repair).
SCPN.L4_CellularTissueSynchronisation: Houses the L4 Central Pattern Generators (CPGs) for somatic motor control (e.g., walking, breathing).
SCPN.L5_OrganismalPsychoemotional: The primary conduit for all somatic 'felt-sense' data (touch, temperature, pain, proprioception) that is integrated by the D3.Brain into the L5 Self-Soliton.
SCPN.L9_MemoryHolograph: Somatic and 'muscle memory' are encoded within the L4 CPGs and L9 fields of the PNS.

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'Nadis' or subtle energy channels that distribute Prana/Chi (L4/L5 information) from the central channel (D3.SpinalCord) to the entire body.
